clues.text: You can get royally full on this dish that calls for cubed chicken, mushrooms, a sherry cream sauce and a few slices of toast
Said to have been invented in Glasgow in the 1970s, this spiced Indian curry is often called a national dish of Britain
A debate that continues to tear the country apart: should chicken wings come with a side of blue cheese or this dressing
For a flavorful chicken Marsala, chefs recommend using real Marsala, a fortified wine made on this Italian island
In Japan, these succulent chicken skewers are grilled over a smokeless type of charcoal called binchotan
The very first of these microblogging posts was sent by company cofounder Jack Dorsey on March 21, 2006
To make natural rubber, start by collecting latex by cutting slits in this layer of the rubber tree
A Dutch term for a seller of ineffective medicines led to this word for an incompetent physician
This word follows Chesapeake, Hudson and Guantanamo in the names of bodies of water
Players of this instrument "are just belligerent, and cocky, and you know just hard-headed" according to Wynton Marsalis
Will Smith was so smitten with his canine co-star in this 2007 film that he wanted to adopt her
In his first-ever TV interview, Cormac McCarthy sat down with Oprah Winfrey after she selected this bleak novel for her book club
Over 11 total seasons of "The Walking Dead", this "Z" word was surprisingly never used by a character
Moviegoers were snack-shamed for chewing popcorn too loudly during this mostly silent film directed by John Krasinski
Kevin Costner starred in two post-apocalyptic films in the 1990s: "Waterworld" and this misfire about a nameless drifter

rounds.comments: (Ken: This one's a little easier. All the correct responses will begin with "Z", end with "A".)

clues.text: A football referee gets this animal-inspired nickname thanks to the standard black & white striped uniform
You'd say this four-letter word while reciting the Greek alphabet, or, when greeting Michael Douglas' wife
In a classic 1986 Nintendo game, Link tries to rescue this title princess from Ganon
Last name of the musician who had kids named Moon Unit, Dweezil, Ahmet & Diva
This fitness program began when an aerobics instructor swapped out his usual music with salsa & merengue songs
Punishable by fine or imprisonment of one year or less, they're much more common than felonies in many states
This term for the termination of a proceeding without a verdict sounds like the end of a school class
Glenn Close knew they're monies awarded to a litigant for loss or injury
This other "A" word is an accomplice or abettor in a crime but is not there when it is committed
In order to get a more objective trial, ask for a "change of" this to seek to have a case heard in a new jurisdiction
Total cubic feet of earth in a hole 1 yard wide, 1 yard long & 1 yard deep
clues.response: there is no earth in that hole (no dirt at all in a hole)

clues.text: If you're running in a race & overtake the person in second place, you're now in this position
If the vice president & the Speaker of the House were to die, the person in this post would be president
Of Boris Karloff, Lon Chaney or Colin Clive, the one who played the title role in the 1931 film "Frankenstein"
The brother-in-law of your mother's unmarried only sibling is this relative to you

An Australia native:
I AM A CAM AD

New World native that's rich in protein:
CHEW AS

There are European & Japanese varieties:
SCENT HUT

Used in baklava & ice cream:
IOTA CHIPS

From the birch family:
ZEAL HUNT

Coming from Maine to the prairie:
her "Plain and Tall"

An eccentric teacher at a girls' school:
"The Prime of" her

Frontwoman for a fictional '70s rock band in a novel & streaming series:
her "& the Six"
A Virginia Woolf socialite, first name Clarissa
James M. Cain's divorcée & single mom, portrayed by Joan Crawford & Kate Winslet
The title character of this musical shows up at 17 Cherry Tree Lane, London & works her magic
In this Lerner & Loewe show, Colonel Pickering, author of "Spoken Sanskrit", makes a dare to a colleague
The MGM Studio Chorus backs up Judy Garland on this movie musical's "The Trolley Song"
The original London soundtrack of this musical features Jonathan Pryce & Lea Salonga
This 2001 movie musical set in Paris is now a stage show with new(er) songs like "Rolling In The Deep" & "Bad Romance"
The Nile has 3 main sections: the Atbara & the ones known by these 2 colors
The Congo River was renamed this from 1971 to 1997; the Democratic Republic also had that name
The mighty Okavango River  stretches from Angola to this desert in Botswana, where it becomes a swamp
The Draa River in Morocco is also called this 4-letter Arabic word for an intermittent stream
Rivers called the Black, Red & White this flow through Burkina Faso, which used to be called Upper this

Henry Wallace
To be too smart for your own good is to be "too clever by" this
At Northwestern University, classes in the spring one began March 28, 2023
This common measurement for liquor is equal to about 750 milliliters--maybe 17 cocktails?
A bit is this fraction of a dollar
W.E.B. Du Bois spoke of the elite of Black society as the "talented" this fraction

rounds.text: John Elwes, a millionaire Member of Parliament who would go to bed before dusk to save on candles, inspired this character
